title: Lesson 25
paragraph: Study and exam skills help learners manage time, understand material and show knowledge. Good habits like revision, note-taking and practising past papers improve confidence and results.

words.meaning: to study material again to remember it
words.example: Review your notes before the test.

words.meaning: to change or study again to improve
words.example: Revise the essay for clarity.

words.meaning: to do something repeatedly to improve
words.example: Practice speaking English every day.

words.meaning: writing down important information to remember later
words.example: Good note-taking helps with revision.

words.meaning: a small card used to memorise facts
words.japaneseMeaning: フラッシュカード、単語カード
words.example: Use flashcards to learn vocabulary.

words.meaning: a short statement of the main points
words.example: Write a summary after each chapter.

words.meaning: a general description showing main points
words.example: Create an outline before writing your essay.

words.meaning: methods used to perform well in tests
words.example: Learn exam techniques for multiple-choice questions.

words.meaning: a question type with several answer options
words.example: Read every option carefully in multiple-choice tests.

words.meaning: a piece of writing on a topic, often required in exams
words.example: Plan your essay before writing.

words.meaning: a plan showing study times and subjects
words.example: Make a timetable for exam revision.

words.meaning: paying full attention to a task
words.example: Find a quiet place to focus.

words.meaning: the time by which work must be finished
words.example: Finish your project before the deadline.

words.meaning: careful study to find facts or information
words.example: Use reliable sources for research.

words.meaning: a list of sources used in written work
words.example: Include a bibliography at the end of your report.

words.meaning: a reference to a source of information
words.example: Cite your sources correctly to avoid plagiarism.

words.meaning: using someone else's work as your own
words.example: Avoid plagiarism by writing in your own words.

words.meaning: a person who guides or oversees work
words.example: Ask your supervisor for feedback on the draft.

words.meaning: comments intended to improve work
words.example: Use feedback to improve your essay.

words.meaning: to read and correct mistakes in a text
words.example: Proofread your work before submission.

words.meaning: spoken rather than written
words.example: Prepare for the oral part of the exam.

words.meaning: the mark or points received in a test
words.example: Aim to improve your score on the next quiz.
